intro: Antidesma cuspidatum var. leiodiscus, commonly known as the smooth-fruited antidesma, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, often glabrous bark and elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecosystems it inhabits.
